happyr 1.0
  • Reference

Retrieve the top-10 lexically diverse metaphors

Source: R/get_lexically_diverse_metaphors.R
get_lexically_diverse_metaphors.Rd

This function calls the script to output the top-10 metaphors that have high index of lexical creativity in their linguistic manifestation. The lexical creativity is derived from the type-per-token ratio (TTR) measure (Rajeg, 2018, Chapter 6). The alternative function with shorter name is get_creative_metaphors.

get_lexically_diverse_metaphors(
  df_ttr_out = NULL,
  min_token = 3,
  top_n_limit = 10
)

Arguments

df_ttr_out

the tibble as the output of ttr.

min_token

minimum token frequency of the metaphors.

top_n_limit

limit for presenting the top-n most lexically diverse metaphors.

Value

A tibble data frame.

References

Rajeg, G. P. W. (2018). Metaphorical profiles and near-synonyms: A corpus-based study of Indonesian words for HAPPINESS (PhD Thesis). Monash University. Melbourne, Australia.

Examples

# get the ttr table
ttr_metaphor <- ttr(phd_data_metaphor,
                    schema_var = "metaphors",
                    lexunit_var = "lu",
                    float_digits = 2)

# get the lexically diverse metaphors
get_lexically_diverse_metaphors(df_ttr_out = ttr_metaphor,
                                min_token = 3,
                                top_n_limit = 10)
#> # A tibble: 10 × 6
